databases module

class databases.DatabaseManager(db_name='school_management.db')[source]

Bases: object

A class to manage the SQLite database for school management.

This class provides methods to interact with the database, including creating tables, adding students, instructors, and courses, enrolling students, and assigning instructors. It also supports searching and backing up the database.

Parameters:

db_name (str) – The name of the SQLite database file. Default is ‘school_management.db’.

add_course(course_name, course_id)[source]

Add a new course to the database.

Parameters:

  • course_name (str) – The name of the course.

  • course_id (int) – A unique identifier for the course.

Returns:

The row ID of the newly inserted course.

Return type:

int

add_instructor(name, age, email, instructor_id)[source]

Add a new instructor to the database.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The age of the instructor.

  • email (str) – The instructor’s email address.

  • instructor_id (int) – A unique identifier for the instructor.

Returns:

The row ID of the newly inserted instructor.

Return type:

int

add_student(name, age, email, student_id)[source]

Add a new student to the database.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the student.

  • age (int) – The age of the student.

  • email (str) – The student’s email address.

  • student_id (int) – A unique identifier for the student.

Returns:

The row ID of the newly inserted student.

Return type:

int

assign_instructor_to_course(instructor_db_id, course_db_id)[source]

Assign an instructor to a course.

Parameters:

  • instructor_db_id (int) – The row ID of the instructor in the database.

  • course_db_id (int) – The row ID of the course in the database.

backup_database(backup_file_path)[source]

Create a backup of the database file.

This method closes the current database connection, copies the database file to the specified backup location using shutil.copy, and then reopens the connection.

Parameters:

backup_file_path (str) – The file path where the database backup should be saved.

close()[source]

Close the connection to the SQLite database.

This method closes the database connection, ensuring that all resources are released.

create_tables()[source]

Create the tables for the database.

This method creates the students, instructors, courses, enrollments, and assignments tables if they do not already exist in the database.

delete_course(course_db_id)[source]

Delete a course from the database by its row ID.

Parameters:

course_db_id (int) – The unique row ID of the course in the database.

delete_instructor(instructor_db_id)[source]

Delete an instructor from the database by their row ID.

Parameters:

instructor_db_id (int) – The unique row ID of the instructor in the database.

delete_student(student_db_id)[source]

Delete a student from the database by their row ID.

Parameters:

student_db_id (int) – The unique row ID of the student in the database.

enroll_student_in_course(student_db_id, course_db_id)[source]

Enroll a student in a course.

Parameters:

  • student_db_id (int) – The row ID of the student in the database.

  • course_db_id (int) – The row ID of the course in the database.

Retrieve all courses from the database.

Returns:

A list of all courses in the database.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

get_course_by_id(course_id)[source]

Retrieve a course from the database by its course ID.

Parameters:

course_id (int) – The unique identifier of the course.

Returns:

The course record if found, or None if no course matches the ID.

Return type:

sqlite3.Row or None

course_db_id (int) – The row ID of the course in the database.

remove_student_enrollment(student_db_id, course_db_id)[source]

Remove a student’s enrollment from a course.

Parameters:

  • student_db_id (int) – The row ID of the student in the database.

  • course_db_id (int) – The row ID of the course in the database.

search_courses(search_query)[source]

Search for courses in the database by course name or course ID.

This method performs a search on the courses table, allowing partial matches for the course name or course ID using a SQL LIKE query.

Parameters:

search_query (str) – The search term to match against course names or IDs.

Returns:

A list of courses matching the search query.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

search_instructors(search_query)[source]

Search for instructors in the database by name or instructor ID.

This method performs a search on the instructors table, allowing partial matches for the instructor’s name or instructor ID using a SQL LIKE query.

Parameters:

search_query (str) – The search term to match against instructor names or IDs.

Returns:

A list of instructors matching the search query.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

search_students(search_query)[source]

Search for students in the database by name or student ID.

This method performs a search on the students table, allowing partial matches for the student’s name or student ID using a SQL LIKE query.

Parameters:

search_query (str) – The search term to match against student names or IDs.

Returns:

A list of students matching the search query.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

update_course(course_db_id, course_name, course_id)[source]

Update an existing course’s details in the database.

Parameters:

  • course_db_id (int) – The unique row ID of the course in the database.

  • course_name (str) – The updated name of the course.

  • course_id (int) – The updated unique course identifier.

update_instructor(instructor_db_id, name, age, email, instructor_id)[source]

Update an existing instructor’s details in the database.

Parameters:

  • instructor_db_id (int) – The unique row ID of the instructor in the database.

  • name (str) – The updated name of the instructor.

  • age (int) – The updated age of the instructor.

  • email (str) – The updated email address of the instructor.

  • instructor_id (int) – The updated unique instructor identifier.

update_student(student_db_id, name, age, email, student_id)[source]

Update an existing student’s details in the database.

Parameters:

  • student_db_id (int) – The unique row ID of the student in the database.

  • name (str) – The updated name of the student.

  • age (int) – The updated age of the student.

  • email (str) – The updated email address of the student.

  • student_id (int) – The updated unique student identifier.
